title: INTERACTION – THE ANCIENT BEER FACTORY
body: Beer has always been a very important part of many cultures, existing since time immemorial. The Dwarven in particular have become incredible masters in this craft, creating concoctions that are still famous across the land. Among the darkened ruins you find the broken remains of an ancient Beer factory, its components long broken and rusted by the many years spent in these forgotten halls.
Despite the broken machinery, two small wooden kegs remain seemingly intact. Both kegs are laying horizontally, with a dusty cork on top, and a small brass tap firmly attached to its side.

RULE – MECHANISM INTERACTION
This Interaction does not use charges. Instead, unless a resolution specifies that the token is removed, it remains on the board. In addition, the options for this Interaction are not exclusive—They can be repeated, and sometimes the game state will lead to different outcomes.

title: 1.1 – CHECK THE BARREL
body: Carefully opening the cork on top of the kegs, the familiar scent of alcohol reaches your nose. These brews are unlike anything you’ve ever seen before, despite all your travels. Unfortunately, time has begun to run its course, and judging from the smell the bottom part of the mixture on both kegs seems to have already gone bad. Perhaps you can manage to salvage the top of the brew, and maybe even the portion that has gone bad can be of use somehow…
Write down the Dwarven Brew Expert Status on the Party’s Campaign Log.
Choose another option.

title: 1.2 – EXTRACT THE LIQUID FROM THE TOP
body: Despite the ancient equipment, Dwarven made tools are made to endure the test of time. Scattered around the Beer Factory you can see various pieces of equipment and even some bottles that might still be of some use to extract the liquids contained inside the wooden kegs without wasting it.

Make a Dexterity (red) Skill Challenge of Difficulty 15. Each Ranged Cube you have gives you a +2 bonus to your roll. If you succeed, proceed to resolution 1.6. If you have the Dwarven Brew Expert Status on the Party’s Campaign Log, you succeed without the need to roll. Otherwise, continue reading below.

You rummaged amongst the old factory parts, trying to scrap together anything useful, but the task seems too tricky for now. All the required pieces are scattered in front of you, but you simply don’t seem able to put it together.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.3 – EXTRACT THE LIQUID FROM THE TAP
body: Regardless of the condition of the brew inside the wooden keg, anything Dwarven made will definitely be of some use or another in the coming battles. On the sides of the wooden kegs, each possess a small rusted brass tap, allowing for the concoction inside to be poured directly. As long as you manage to pry it open.

Make a Strength (yellow) Skill Challenge of Difficulty 15. Each Melee cube you have gives you a +2 bonus to your roll. If you succeed, proceed to resolution 1.7. If you have the Dwarven Brew Expert Status on the Party’s Campaign Log, you succeed without the need to roll. Otherwise, continue reading below.
Your attempts to force the tap open seems to yield little to no result other than dirtying your hands with a strange slimy substance.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.4 – TASTE THE LIQUID
body: Forcing the tap on the side of one of the kegs, you manage to squeeze a small amount of liquid from inside. Pouring the mysterious concoction directly into your mouth, chills spread across your body. The taste of the liquid is vile, worse than anything you’ve ever tasted before.
You suffer STUN.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.5 – LEAVE THE FACTORY ALONE
body: Despite the alluring perspective of a refreshing drink amidst so much trouble, something seems strange about this whole situation. How can such a factory be this well preserved after so much time? Is it even safe to touch it?
Filled with caution, you step away from the ancient equipment.
Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.6 – MASTERFUL BREWING
body: You manage to salvage enough components to prepare a makeshift syphon, inserting it from the top of the keg. Skillfully separating the liquids from both barrels, you watch as the delicious dwarven beer turns rancid in colour. Using the salvaged containers to separate the liquids, you find yourself with 4 completely different concoctions.
While the Dwarven Beer still looks drinkable and smells amazing even after all this time, the part that’s gone bad seems to still have some use after all.
Take the Callix Fire Beer, Zullan Rush Beer, Explosive Brew and Winter Brew Adventure Item cards.
Remove this Interaction token from the board. Proceed with the Adventure.

title: 1.7 – DANGEROUS BREWING
body: The brass tap burst open abruptly, creating a vortex inside the keg and spilling most of its content on the floor. As you watch the remaining liquids fill the glass, its strange colour and foul smell are a clear warning that something terribly wrong must have happened with the once wonderful brew.
Take the Explosive Brew and Winter Brew Adventure Item cards.
Remove this Interaction token from the board. Proceed with the Adventure.
